| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line654](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line654 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

A **kamadan**, f, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that is introduced in [SLASH 6](/wiki/SLASH_6 "SLASH 6"), and appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") and [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"). It is a [feline](/wiki/Feline "Feline") with three bite attacks and a breath attack that induces [sleeping](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep").

Eating a kamadan corpse has a 27% chance of conveying [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance").

## Strategy

The kamadan is capable of appearing quite early, and its sleep breath and bites can prove dangerous if you are caught unaware and lacking resistance.

## Origin

The kamadan originates from *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, and is depicted as a beast that almost exactly resembles a leopard, save for the six snakes sprouting from its shoulders. Kamadans hunt using a sleeping gas breath weapon to knock its prey unconscious before moving for the kill; the kamadan's snakes also possess a powerful poison in their bites. They are occasionally speculated in-universe to be related to [displacer beasts](/wiki/Displacer_beast "Displacer beast"), though their similarities are coincidental - in fact, kamadans despise displacer beasts and are known to attack them on sight.

## Encyclopedia entry

The kamadan is a greatly feared hunter that resembles a large leopard with six snakes sprouting from its shoulders. Sages believe it is a distant relative of the displacer beast, though how it came to be is still a matter for speculation.

\[ Creature Catalog by Scott Greene ]

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

Kamadan

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
f kamadan
Difficulty 7
Attacks Breath 1d6 sleep, Bite 1d3, Bite 1d3, Bite 1d3
f kamadan
Difficulty 7
Attacks

Breath 1d6 sleep, Bite 1d3, Bite 1d3, Bite 1d3

Base level 4
Base experience 48
Speed 12
Base AC 4
Base MR 0
Alignment -3 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 750
Nutritional value 400
Size Large
Resistances sleep
Resistances conveyed sleep (27%)

A kamadan:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line654

A kamadan, f, is a type of monster that is introduced in SLASH 6, and appears in SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM. It is a feline with three bite attacks and a breath attack that induces sleeping.

Eating a kamadan corpse has a 27% chance of conveying sleep resistance.

Strategy

The kamadan is capable of appearing quite early, and its sleep breath and bites can prove dangerous if you are caught unaware and lacking resistance.

Origin

The kamadan originates from Dungeons & Dragons, and is depicted as a beast that almost exactly resembles a leopard, save for the six snakes sprouting from its shoulders. Kamadans hunt using a sleeping gas breath weapon to knock its prey unconscious before moving for the kill; the kamadan's snakes also possess a powerful poison in their bites. They are occasionally speculated in-universe to be related to displacer beasts, though their similarities are coincidental - in fact, kamadans despise displacer beasts and are known to attack them on sight.

Encyclopedia entry

The kamadan is a greatly feared hunter that resembles a large leopard with six snakes sprouting from its shoulders. Sages believe it is a distant relative of the displacer beast, though how it came to be is still a matter for speculation.

[ Creature Catalog by Scott Greene ]

A '''kamadan''', {{monsym|kamadan}}, is a type of [[monster]] that is introduced in [[SLASH 6]], and appears in [[SLASH'EM]] and [[SlashTHEM]]. It is a [[feline]] with three bite attacks and a breath attack that induces [[sleep]]ing.

Eating a kamadan corpse has a 27% chance of conveying [[sleep resistance]].

==Strategy==
The kamadan is capable of appearing quite early, and its sleep breath and bites can prove dangerous if you are caught unaware and lacking resistance.

==Origin==
The kamadan originates from ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'', and is depicted as a beast that almost exactly resembles a leopard, save for the six snakes sprouting from its shoulders. Kamadans hunt using a sleeping gas breath weapon to knock its prey unconscious before moving for the kill; the kamadan's snakes also possess a powerful poison in their bites. They are occasionally speculated in-universe to be related to [[displacer beast]]s, though their similarities are coincidental - in fact, kamadans despise displacer beasts and are known to attack them on sight.
